page.title: 14LINFORD WOODS, MILTON KEYNES
page.content: Linford Wood is 1 km from Milton Keynes' city centre. It is a relic of the forest that once covered Britain 5,000 years ago. Records of Linford Wood go back to 1283 when a poacher was reported. The wood has been set aside for walking, exercising, wildlife and forestry conservation. Land round the wood is used for light industry. Trees include oak, ash, field maple, Norway spruce and aspen. There are some dead elm trees because trees have had Dutch elm disease. Speckled Wood and Black Streak butterflies are found. Montague Deer were brought from China to Woburn Wildlife Park, they have escaped and are now in the wood. Many wild flowers and birds are found. There is a specially constructed exercise trail called a Trim Trail which has 3 circuits of different difficulty.
